text: John Henry Newman, (21 February 1801 â€“ 11 August 1890) was an important person in Victorian Christianity in England. He was part of the Oxford Movement in Anglicanism which pushed for a more Catholic faith. He finally converted to the Roman Catholic Church in 1845. He was made a cardinal. He was beatified in 2010. He wrote many books, including an autobiography, and The Dream of Gerontius. ==Early life and education== Newman was born on 21 February 1801 in the City of London, ===Evangelical=== At the age of 15, during his last year at school, Newman was converted, an incident of which he wrote in his Apologia that it was "more certain than that I have hands or feet". ==References== ==Other websites== * * * * Newman reader ===Writings=== * * * Category:1801 births Category:1890 deaths Category:19th-century English philosophers Category:Academics of the University of Oxford Category:Alumni of the University of Oxford Category:Beatified people Category:British cardinals Category:British Christian hymnwriters Category:Christian saints Category:Church of England clergy Category:English theologians Category:Venerated Catholics Category:Writers from London
title: John Henry Newman
